Judge -- Criminal District Court, Section I
CA No. 1 (ACT 200, 2023 - HB 311) -- Prohibits the use of private funds in the administration of elections.
Race.FullText: Do you support an amendment to prohibit the use of funds, goods, or services from a foreign government or a nongovernmental source to conduct elections and election functions and duties unless the use is authorized by the secretary of state through policies established in accordance with law? (Adds Article XI, Section 6)

Race.SpecificTitle: CA No. 2 (ACT 30, 2023 - SB 63) -- Provides that the freedom of worship is a fundamental right worthy of the highest protection.
Race.FullText: Do you support an amendment to provide that the freedom of worship in a church or other place of worship is a fundamental right that is worthy of the highest order of protection? (Adds Const. Article XII, Section 17)

Race.SpecificTitle: CA No. 3 (ACT 107, 2023 - HB 47) -- Dedicates certain payments to be applied to the state retirement system unfunded accrued liability.
Race.FullText: Do you support an amendment to require that a minimum of twenty-five percent of any money designated as nonrecurring state revenue be applied toward the balance of the unfunded accrued liability of the state retirement systems? (Amends Article VII, Section 10(D)(2)(b)(ii) and (iii))

Race.SpecificTitle: CA No. 4 (ACT 48, 2023 - HB 46) -- Restricts ad valorem tax exemptions for certain nonprofit organizations.
Race.FullText: Do you support an amendment to deny a property tax exemption to a nonprofit corporation or association that owns residential property in such a state of disrepair that it endangers public health or safety? (Amends Article VII, Section 21(B))

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Delcambre -- 1% S&U Tax - M&BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Delcambre, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), be authorized to levy a 1% sales and use tax (the "Tax") in accordance with Louisiana law (an estimated $300,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of 10 years from January 1, 2024, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated and used for the purposes of providing funds for public safety in the Town and for any other lawful purpose of the Town?
